meanings.definition: Move quickly and smoothly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit can zip across the field in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She likes to zip through her chores to have more time to play.
meanings.sent3: I saw a squirrel zip up the tree with lightning speed!
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to zip by as they danced the night away.
meanings.sent5: The car can zip along the highway effortlessly.

meanings.definition: A fastening device consisting of two parallel rows of metal or plastic teeth on strips that are interlocked by a sliding tab.
meanings.sent1: She pulled the zip on her jacket to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: The zip on the bag broke, so she couldn't close it properly.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally caught his tie in the zip of his backpack.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the zip opening filled the quiet room.
meanings.sent5: The zip on the tent kept the insects out during the camping trip.
